channel.title: News on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community
channel.description: Recent content in News on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community

item.title: Announcing PowerShell Magazine author toolkit v1.0
item.description: We just announced moving PowerShell Magazine from WordPress platform to a statically generated GitHub pages based platform. We use Hugo to compile markdown content to HTML and host that on GitHub pages.

item.title: The all new PowerShell Magazine is here and more to come!
item.description: This one took a while but we finally moved to a new home! No more painful management of plugins and updates to PHP.

item.title: PowerShell Conference EU 2017 – Speakers and Sessions
item.description: Modern administrators are responsible for business-critical automation, influence IT architectural design, and are a crucial part of corporate security both in daily operations and in conceptual planning.

item.title: Open source PowerShell on Windows, Linux, and OS X!
item.description: This article was co-authored by Bartek Bielawski and Ben Gelens. Windows PowerShell is a powerful tool, but it always had one very serious limitation: it was possible to run it only on Windows.

item.title: Announcing Registrations – PowerShell Conference Asia 2016, Singapore
item.description: PowerShell Conference Asia is back. After a successful last year, we are back with a really exciting line up of sessions and speakers.

item.title: ISESteroids 2.6 with new version of PSSharper released
item.description: PowerShell is everywhere these days. And solid PowerShell skills are probably among the most important personal career factors for an IT professional today.

item.title: Windows 10 Anniversary Update Brings Remoting Support for BITS
item.description: In this article we will look at a new feature in the BITS service which is included in Windows. Some background:

item.title: From PSConfEU 2016 – Session Recordings
item.description: Session recordings – both videos and screencasts – from PowerShell Conference Europe 2016 are now available. It may be a couple of days before all sessions appear in the playlist.

item.title: PowerShell Conference Europe Speakers and Sessions
item.description: PowerShell is not just a simple little script automation language anymore. It has transitioned into true DNA for Microsoft server technology, and with workflows and DSC forms the platform for “infrastructure as code”.

item.title: PowerShell Extension for #VisualStudio Code #Connect2015
item.description: If you are not watching #VisualStudio #Connect2015, you are certainly missing a lot. Because … @ScottGu just announced a lot of new features including extension support in Visual Studio Code.

item.title: PowerShell Conference EU 2016 – Registration Starts Now
item.description: In 2016, the newly minted “PowerShell Conference EU” will be hosted in Hannover, Germany, and may well become the largest PowerShell conference world-wide with its 160 delegates and 30 speakers.

item.title: Summary from PowerShell Summit Europe 2015
item.description: The PowerShell Summit Europe 2015 was arranged in Stockholm, Sweden on September 14-16. This was a unique opportunity to meet community people you mostly know from Twitter and other social media, as well as product group members from Microsoft.

item.title: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 – Get-Here: Travel Tips
item.description: As the PowerShell Conference draws closer, people have been asking a number of travel questions, so we wanted to share some travel tips.

item.title: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 Update – Registration is Open!
item.description: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already.

item.title: Introducing DNS Policies in Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview 2
item.description: In this article, we will have a look at DNS Policies – a new feature in the DNS Server role introduced in Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview 2 (TP2):

item.title: PowerShell Conference Asia, 2015 – call for speakers and sponsors
item.description: Exciting times! On September 18-19 2015, we at the Singapore PowerShell User Group are planning to host the first PowerShell Conference Asia.

item.title: Windows Management Framework 5.0 February preview available
item.description: Windows PowerShell team announced the availability of Windows Management Framework (WMF) 5.0 Preview February 2015. This preview is available for Windows 8.

item.title: Announcing DSC resources to deploy Hyper-V converged virtual network
item.description: The converged virtual network within Hyper-V deployments is a common configuration. There are multiple ways to deploy the converged network configuration.

item.title: PowerShell cmdlets to manage Azure Key Vault
item.description: Microsoft announced a public preview of Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault is a cloud-hosted HSM-backed service for managing cryptographic keys and other secrets used in your cloud applications.

item.title: Holiday gift from Windows PowerShell team – DSC Resource Kit Wave 9
item.description: Windows PowerShell team just released a new wave of DSC resources taking the overall DSC resource count to 172! This is a great accomplishment within a single year!

item.title: ISESteroids RC
item.description: ISESteroids originally started as a simple add-on to add professional editor capabilities to the built-in PowerShell ISE editor. Meanwhile, it evolved to a slick high-end PowerShell script editor.

item.title: DSC changes in Windows Management Framework 5.0 Preview November 2014 release
item.description: If you’ve missed Windows PowerShell team’s announcement, WMF 5.0 Preview November 2014 release is out. This Windows Management Framework (WMF) preview includes everything from WMF 5.

item.title: Azure PowerShell Tools 0.8.10 is available
item.description: If you have missed it, Scott Gu announced major set of updates to Azure services. At a high level, these changes include,

item.title: PowerShell Magazine completes 3 years!
item.description: Time just flies. On 13th of this month, PowerShell Magazine completed 3 years of publishing exclusive PowerShell content. This was possible because of ever growing support from our awesome contributors.

item.title: New features introduced in Windows Management Framework 5.0 Preview September 2014
item.description: Windows Management Framework 5.0 Preview September 2014 was released on September 4. An overview of new features added since the May 2014 Preview is listed in the announcement on the Windows PowerShell Team blog, while additional details are available in the release notes.

item.title: Microsoft Azure PowerShell 0.8.8 is available
item.description: Just a few hours ago, Azure team released Microsoft Azure PowerShell 0.8.8. The new release has a lot of improvements and added a support for today’s Azure update–Role-Based Access Control in Azure Preview Portal.

item.title: Book: Announcing Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration Revealed
item.description: If you have followed my posts here and/or heard me speaking in the last 6 to 8 months, I have been mostly focusing on Desired State Configuration.

item.title: Windows Management Framework 5.0 (September 2014) preview is available for download
item.description: An updated version of WMF 5.0 preview is now available with a great set of enhancements and new features. Some of these changes are:

item.title: DSC Resource Kit Wave 6 is here!
item.description: Windows PowerShell team published a new wave of DSC Resource Kit. It is Wave 6! This wave contains four new resources:

item.title: Azure PowerShell Tools 0.8.7 is available
item.description: Just a few hours ago, Azure PowerShell Tools version 0.8.7 was released. This release includes enhancements to the existing cmdlets.

item.title: Bartek Bielawski joins PowerShell Magazine editorial board
item.description: I am very happy to announce that Bartek Bielawski joined the PowerShell Magazine editorial board. Bartek is a multi-year recipient of Microsoft MVP award for Windows PowerShell.

item.title: Azure PowerShell Tools version 0.8.6 is available
item.description: The Azure PowerShell Tools are updated very often. But, this 0.8.6 release, is special and has many features that I was looking forward to.

item.title: DSC Resource Kit Wave 5 is available
item.description: Windows PowerShell team released DSC Resource Kit Wave 5. This wave has added the following xWordPress: This module contains two resources, xIISWordPressSite and xWordPressSite, as well as example configurations under Samples, which show end-to-end deployment of the common WordPress site.

item.title: Microsoft announced the CTP release of Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration for Linux
item.description: When I was speaking at DevOpsDays India and demonstrating Windows PowerShel DSC (6 months ago), several people in the room had a laugh as I’d mentioned Microsoft and OpenSource.

item.title: PowerShell module management as a native feature is here!
item.description: Windows PowerShell team just announced the availability of WMF 5.0 Preview May 2014 release. This includes an exciting new feature called PowerShellGet.

item.title: Windows PowerShell 4.0 and Other Quick Reference Guides
item.description: We are pleased to announce the availability of Windows PowerShell 4.0 quick reference guides created by PowerShell Magazine. They are now part of “Windows PowerShell 4.

item.title: Microsoft Azure Automation
item.description: Microsoft launched a new service to simplify public, private, and hybrid clouds management. Using the Microsoft Azure Automation preview you can automate the creation, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of resources in your Microsoft Azure environment using runbooks, which under the hood are Windows PowerShell workflows.

item.title: Script Browser for Windows PowerShell ISE
item.description: Microsoft has released a new ISE add-on, developed by Microsoft Customer Services & Support (CSS) team, that enables you to easilysearch and download scripts from the TechNet Script Center, from within the scripting environment.

item.title: Windows Management Framework 5.0 preview is here!
item.description: While the PowerShell community is still looking at the Desired State Configuration feature in PowerShell 4.0, Windows Server team already announced the preview release of Windows Management Framework 5.

item.title: Is native Windows PowerShell support coming to Visual Studio?
item.description: Not completely yet. But, the Visual Studio 2013 Update 2 RC release seems to be a step in that direction. This update includes PowerShell syntax highlighting in the Visual Studio Editor.

item.title: Announcing PowerShell module for managing Kemp LoadMaster appliances
item.description: In an earlier article, I talked about managing Kemp LoadMaster appliances (both physical and virtual) using the Kemp’s RESTful API. Using RESTful API is complex because you need to know all the details of how API is implemented and what are different features available to you.

item.title: Jan Egil Ring joins PowerShell Magazine
item.description: I am very happy to announce that Jan Egil Ring accepted to join PowerShell Magazine. Jan is a known personality in the Windows PowerShell and virtualization communities.

item.title: WMI Query Language via PowerShell available on Kindle
item.description: Back in 2011, I published a free book on learning WMI Query Language (WQL) via PowerShell. It was a huge success.

item.title: Another important milestone! PowerShell Magazine has published 500 posts!
item.description: You are reading the 500th post on PowerShell Magazine. Wow, what a journey! We had our share of ups and downs but kept this going for a good reason.

item.title: Announcing PowerShell Saturday India
item.description: PowerShell Bangalore User Group (PSBUG) and Bangalore IT Pro are happy to announce the first ever PowerShell Saturday event in India.

item.title: Announcing PowerShell Information Server (PSIS)
item.description: Johan Akerstrom – PowerShell expert from Sweden – released a PowerShell module that can be used to start a PowerShell-based web server.

item.title: PowerShell Magazine Day!
item.description: Today is PowerShell Magazine Day at Manning Books. Save 50% on these selected books. Just enter dotd1217cc in the Promotional Code box when you check out at manning.

item.title: HP Scripting Tools for Windows PowerShell
item.description: HP has released a PowerShell module HPiLOCmdlets, designed to help IT experts to configure and manage HP iLO 3 and iLO 4 using Windows PowerShell.

item.title: PowerTips Monthly: PowerShell Reference Library
item.description: For the past 5 years, PowerShell MVP Tobias Weltner has published a daily tip on powershell.com. Together with fellow MVP Aleksandar Nikolic, he’s started revising and compiling this huge tips collection for you and came up with ready-to-use pocket guides of PowerShell knowledge.

item.title: Windows Management Framework 4.0 is now available!
item.description: Windows Management Framework 4.0 is available for installation on Windows 7 SP1, Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012, and Windows Embedded 7.

item.title: Announcing Kemp Technologies as a technology partner
item.description: We are very happy to announce Kemp Technologies as our technology partner. Kemp Technologies is an emerging leader in theload balancers and application delivery optimization market.

item.title: PC Monitor – Remotely monitor and manage your critical systems
item.description: Mobile PC Monitor is an innovative solution for monitoring and managing mission-critical IT systems using a secure mobile application that gives IT administrators complete control of their critical servers and applications from anywhere, anytime.

item.title: Announcing PSReadLine – A bash-inspired readline implementation for PowerShell
item.description: Jason Shirk is back! He just announced the release of his new PowerShell project PSReadLine. In PowerShell 3.0, a hook was added to replace the command line editing experience in the console and Jason wrote a new module to take advantage of this hook.

item.title: Dell announced the availability of vWorkspace PowerShell module beta
item.description: Dell announced the availability of beta version of PowerShell module for Dell vWorkspace. As per the announcement, the features included in this beta release are:

item.title: Why PowerShell?
item.description: Have you ever been asked this question and scratched your head for an answer? If so (and if not), Mark Minasi, is doing a free 40 to 60 minute webinar on the subject.

item.title: SAPIEN Technologies announces the availability of PowerRegEx – Community Preview
item.description: Just when I was thinking that there is a need for a nice regular expression helper for PowerShell, SAPIEN Technologies announced the community preview of their new product called PowerRegEx.

item.title: PowerShell module for Lync Online is available
item.description: Microsoft has released a PowerShell module for Lync Online. You can now use the module to enable and disable push notifications for both iPhones and Windows Phones, manage Exchange Unified Messaging and hosted voicemail policies, manage meeting room endpoint devices with a Microsoft Exchange Server 2013 resource mailbox, grant client inband policies using pre-created policy instances, and you can also utilize Exchange Online cmdlets to extend the capabilities of Lync Online reports beyond the currently available reports in the Office 365 admin center.

item.title: PSharp makes PowerShell ISE better
item.description: Here’s another cool project created by PowerShell MVP Doug Finke. PSharp is a tool designed for PowerShell’s Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) editor.

item.title: Announcing PoshTools – Visual Studio extension for PowerShell Scripting
item.description: Ever wondered why isn’t there support for writing PowerShell scripts in Visual Studio? I have had several projects where I needed to integrate PowerShell scripts into a C# solution I created in Visual Studio.

item.title: New version of the Windows Azure PowerShell
item.description: Few days ago the new version (0.6.17) of the Windows Azure PowerShell has been released. The Windows Azure PowerShell provides IT Pros and developers with Windows PowerShell cmdlets for building, deploying, and managing Windows Azure services.

item.title: PowerShell Deep Dives book
item.description: The PowerShell Deep Dives book is ready for your reading pleasure! The book, written by Microsoft MVPs and PowerShell community experts, contains 28 chapters grouped in four parts: Administration, Scripting, Development, and Platforms.

item.title: Advanced Tools & Scripting with PowerShell 3.0
item.description: After the Getting started with PowerShell 3.0 event on Microsoft Virtual Academy, Jeffrey Snover and Jason Helmick are back with another full day PowerShell training event.

item.title: Tobias Weltner joins PowerShell Magazine
item.description: We are very happy to announce that Tobias Weltner accepted our offer to join PowerShell Magazine’s editorial board. For people in the PowerShell community, Tobias is not an unknown face.

item.title: Getting Started with PowerShell 3.0
item.description: Interested in a free PowerShell course tailored especially for IT Professionals? Want to know more about PowerShell and how to use it?

item.title: Windows Management Framework 4.0 Preview download is available
item.description: Microsoft announced that the Windows Management Framework (WMF) 4.0 preview is available for download on Microsoft download center. Windows Management Framework (WMF) 4.

item.title: New Features in Windows PowerShell 4.0
item.description: “Windows PowerShell 4.0 includes several significant features that extend its use, improve its usability, and allow you to control and manage Windows-based environments more easily and comprehensively.

item.title: PowerShell Magazine teams up again with the TechMentor conference
item.description: We are happy to announce that PowerShell Magazine is an “Alliance Media Partner” for the TechMentor Las Vegas conference. Surrounded by your fellow IT professionals, TechMentor provides you with immediately usable IT education that will keep you relevant in the workforce.

item.title: TechEd North America 2013 sessions you don’t want to miss
item.description: We are all eager to see what Microsoft will announce at the TechEd North America 2013 conference that starts on Monday.

item.title: Get to know PowerShell 3.0 with Jeffery Hicks
item.description: On May 22nd, 2013, MVP Systems Software is hosting a free webinar on introduction to PowerShell 3.0. PowerShell MVP and a well known author Jeffery Hicks will be presenting this.

item.title: PowerShell Summit 2013 session recordings
item.description: Haven’t had the chance to attend the PowerShell Summit? You can now watch the recordings on YouTube thanks to Aaron Hoover, one of the great PowerShell enthusiasts who attended this successful PowerShell event.

item.title: PowerShell Summit 2013: Build Your Demo Environment or a Test Lab with Windows PowerShell
item.description: I’ve had a pleasure to speak at PowerShell Summit North America 2013. I would like to thank the organizers, all attendees–amazing, passionate PowerShellers who made this event such a huge success, Microsoft and PowerShell team, and a few generous individuals who helped me to be a part of an unforgettable experience.

item.title: New PowerShell Book: PowerShell 3.0 Advanced Administration Handbook
item.description: Packt Publishing has released a new book on Windows PowerShell “PowerShell 3.0 Advanced Administration Handbook“. This book was authored by PowerShell MVPs Sherif Talaat and Haijun Fu.

item.title: 2013 PowerShell Scripting Games
item.description: Mark your calendars. Registrations for the 2013 Scripting Games begin on April 22. To get a better understanding of how the games work this year (hosted on PowerShell.

item.title: PowerGUI Script Editor gets full support for PowerShell 3.0
item.description: Dell released PowerGUI 3.6.0 script editor early this week. With this release, PowerGUI includes full support for Windows PowerShell 3.0 and support for Windows 8 / Windows Server 2012 Operating Systems.

item.title: Heads up: Microsoft Script Explorer reaches the end of the road
item.description: Due to low adoption and usage of the pre-release versions of Script Explorer, Microsoft has decided to take the project down, starting by removing the RC package from the Download Center.

item.title: Channel 9’s MMS 2013 RSS feed is more fun with PowerShell
item.description: The MMS 2013 conference starts next week. The keynote and sessions will be available for replay through the Channel 9 web site.

item.title: Write a #PSTip and win a copy of Packt’s Oracle Database and PowerShell How-to eBook
item.description: We are pleased to announce that we have teamed up with Packt Publishing again and are organizing a giveaway especially for you.

item.title: Free PowerShell 3.0 eBook in Brazilian Portuguese
item.description: Daniel Donda, Windows Expert-IT Pro MVP, has released a new PowerShell eBook written in Brazilian Portuguese. Windows PowerShell 3.0 for IT Pro is an eBook written with infrastructure administrators in mind.

item.title: The Windows PowerShell 3.0 SDK Sample Pack
item.description: Microsoft has released the Windows PowerShell 3.0 SDK Sample Pack. The pack contains code samples that show how to build applications based on Windows PowerShell 3.

item.title: PowerShell Magazine is a media partner for TechMentor, Orlando
item.description: We are happy to announce that PowerShell Magazine is a media partner for TechMentor, Orlando. About TechMentor: Surrounded by your fellow IT professionals, TechMentor provides you with immediately usable IT education that will keep you relevant in the workforce.

item.title: New version of the Windows Azure PowerShell
item.description: Few days ago the new version (0.6.10) of the Windows Azure PowerShell has been released. The Windows Azure PowerShell provides IT Pros and developers with Windows PowerShell cmdlets for building, deploying, and managing Windows Azure services.

item.title: PowerCLI 5.1 Release 2 is released
item.description: PowerCLI 5.1 Release 2 has now been released and can be downloaded here. Other than bug fixes and new enhancements, the new release supports PowerShell 3.

item.title: Windows PowerShell for SharePoint 2013 – A learning roadmap
item.description: Microsoft has recently published a learning roadmap to understand Windows PowerShell for SharePoint 2013. Microsoft SharePoint 2013, as many other updated Microsoft products, has an increased number of cmdlets to perform SharePoint management tasks.

item.title: Windows PowerShell – 2013 Technology of the Year Award winner
item.description: Chosen from all products reviewed, tested, worked with, explored, and relied on throughout the year, InfoWorld’s Technology of the Year Award winners represent the best of the best for end-users, developers, IT pros, and the businesses they serve.

item.title: Windows PowerShell 3.0 language specification available for download
item.description: Microsoft released Windows PowerShell 3.0 Language specification to the public. This is a 334 pages of documentation and has tons of information on how the language is implemented.

item.title: PowerShell conference in Germany
item.description: In the scenic setting of the Museum for Industrial and Social History in Oberhausen, Germany, the first German PowerShell Community Conference will take place on April 10 and 11, 2013.

item.title: Preparing Data for the Report
item.description: One of PowerShell’s most common uses is to collect data and then generate reports from that data. There are a number of different formats in which PowerShell can export data for reporting purposes, such as CSV, XML, and HTML.

item.title: PowerShell Magazine has a new home!
item.description: PowerShell Magazine – since it’s inception – has certainly been growing in popularity and readership. We moved from 100 posts to 230+ in no time.

item.title: PowerShell Workflows
item.description: Today we have a real treat for you–an excerpt about the Windows PowerShell Workflow feature from the upcoming book Learn PowerShell Toolmaking in a Month of Luncheswritten by Don Jones and Jeffery Hicks.

item.title: Learn Windows PowerShell 3 in a Month of Lunches
item.description: The second edition of Don Jones and Jeffery Hicks’s bestseller, Learn Windows PowerShell 3 in a Month of Lunches, is released as an eBook.

item.title: New version of PowerShell Help files
item.description: If you start Windows PowerShell with the Run as Administrator option and then type Update-Help -Force -Verbose you should get the new version of some PowerShell Help XML-based files and About topics.

item.title: Two WMI cheat sheets for PowerShell users and developers from the WMI team!
item.description: Osama Sajid from the Windows Management Infrastructure team blogged about two WMI cheat sheets created by the WMI team. The first cheat sheet contains information to get you started with the CIM cmdlets in PowerShell 3.

item.title: Multi-Server Management with Windows PowerShell
item.description: These videos were released yesterday on YouTube. They are part of the Windows Server 2012 Jump Start video series published on Microsoft TechNet.

item.title: PowerShell Plus is Free!
item.description: Idera, a leading provider of application and server management solutions, today demonstrated its strong commitment to the PowerShell community by making its PowerShell Plus product available for free.

item.title: Two new PowerShell modules related to Storage Spaces
item.description: Bruce Langworthy, Senior Program Manager with the Storage and FileSystems team at Microsoft, just posted two new PowerShell modules designed to help with the management and diagnosis of Storage Spaces.

item.title: Windows PowerShell Cookbook 3rd edition
item.description: The popular PowerShell Cookbook, by Lee Holmes, has reached its 3rd edition and is updated for PowerShell 3.0. The book has not yet been released and is available for pre-order.

item.title: New Book: Microsoft PowerShell 3.0 First Look
item.description: It’s published! Microsoft PowerShell 3.0 First Look, by Adam Driscoll, is a concise overview of the up and coming features and enhancements to PowerShell.

item.title: Happy Birthday, PowerShell Magazine!
item.description: Last year, on this day, we announced the launch of PowerShell Magazine. It has been an interesting year. We are proud to say that we are the exclusive PowerShell online magazine and proud of what we have achieved so far!

item.title: PowerShell 3.0 is available for downlevel systems
item.description: Windows Management Framework 3.0 was released yesterday. It includes updated management functionality for Windows 7 Service Pack 1, Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, and Windows Server 2008 Service Pack 2 (Windows Vista, Windows XP, and Windows Server 2003 are not supported).

item.title: New PowerShell community website
item.description: PowerShell.org is a new community site, led by PowerShell MVPs Don Jones and Kirk Munro, designed to be a general-purpose gathering place and portal for Windows PowerShell, providing discussion forums, technical articles, blog posts, and other resources.

item.title: PoSHStats for Hyper-V 3.0
item.description: PowerShell MVP Yusuf Ozturk released a project he’s been working on lately – PoSHStats v1.1. PoSHStats is the first free and open source reporting tool of Hyper-V resource metering.

item.title: PowerShell 2.0 Help on Windows Phone
item.description: Rolf Masuch [MSFT], a former PowerShell MVP, has created the PowerShell Help app for Windows Phone. The app gives you a searchable list of the PowerShell v2 cmdlets.

item.title: Announcing Microsoft All-In-One Script Framework
item.description: We are very excited about the RTM of Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012. You know the reason, right? The final version of Windows PowerShell 3.

item.title: Jeffrey Snover on RunAs Radio
item.description: RunAs Radio is a weekly Internet audio talk show for IT Professionals working with Microsoft products. The full range of IT topics is covered from a Microsoft-centric viewpoint.

item.title: Configuration Manager PowerShell SDK
item.description: Working with PowerShell and Configuration Manager? Check out the Configuration Manager PowerShell SDK website, created by MVP Kaido Järvemet. It is targeted toward Configuration Manager administrators and developers who are looking for How-To examples.

item.title: Workflow documentation now live on TechNet
item.description: Some of you have noticed that the CTP Workflow PDF guide that was a part of PowerShell 3.0 CTP download is no longer available.

item.title: Windows PowerShell 3.0 and Server Manager Quick Reference Guides (updated)
item.description: Microsoft has updated the Quick Reference Guides page with a new PDF guide: WMI and CIM quick reference. The two page guide describes differences between Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) in Windows PowerShell 2.

item.title: PowerShell Videos From TechEd North America 2012
item.description: For those of us who couldn’t make it to Tech Ed this year, you can watch the live stream of today’s sessions HERE (begins at 08:30).

item.title: Windows PowerShell 3.0 and Server Manager Quick Reference Guides
item.description: We are pleased to announce the availability of Windows PowerShell 3.0 quick reference guides that PowerShell Magazine has created and are now part of “Windows PowerShell 3.

item.title: Visualize your data using PowerShell: Introducing SeeShell
item.description: Jim Christopher, a Windows PowerShell MVP and a founder of Code Owls LLC, announced the release of SeeShell—a toolkit to visualize the data from various sources such as WMI objects, performance counters, event logs, files, databases, system events, etc.

item.title: Microsoft PowerShell 3.0 First Look
item.description: Microsoft PowerShell 3.0 First Look, by Adam Driscoll, is a concise overview of the up and coming features and enhancements to PowerShell.

item.title: Windows Management Framework 3.0 RC is available for download
item.description: The RC version is available for download HERE. You can also find the download link in the Downloads section in the right hand side column of the magazine’s home page.

item.title: PowerShell for Developers
item.description: The new book, ”PowerShell for Developers” written by our Editor and PowerShell MVP Doug Finke, is available in early release at a significant discount.

item.title: Master-PowerShell | With Dr. Tobias Weltner
item.description: The popular free eBook has been updated for PowerShell 2.0. You can read it online. You need to be a PowerShell.

item.title: PrimalScript 2012 and PowerShell Studio 2012
item.description: SAPIEN Technologies has announced the immediate availability of PrimalScript 2012, the premiere Scripting Integrated Development Environment, and PowerShell Studio 2012. PowerShell Studio, has all the features of its predecessor, PrimalForms, plus a raft of new features for 2012.

item.title: Windows PowerShell 3.0 Step by Step
item.description: The book, by Ed Wilson, the Microsoft Scripting Guy, is available for pre-order (45% off) on Amazon.

item.title: Day 3 From the PowerShell Deep Dive at TEC 2012
item.description: On the third and final day of the PowerShell Deep Dive, the great content continued to roll. The morning started with a bang when Richard Siddaway opened up with an overview of CDXML and how, using an XML configuration file, one can generate cmdlets from a WMI interface.

item.title: Day 2 From the PowerShell Deep Dive at TEC 2012
item.description: On the second day of the PowerShell Deep Dive, we had another great lineup of presentations. The day started with Jim Truher describing a technique for creating formatting files for using Format-Custom.

item.title: Office 365 Helper Script Examples
item.description: If you’re working with Office 365 than you may want to check out the Office 365 Helper Scripts package. This package includes a number of helper scripts created during Office 365 deployments.

item.title: Day 1 From the PowerShell Deep Dive at TEC 2012
item.description: Day 1 has wrapped up on the PowerShell Deep Dive and we are getting ready to start Day 2. Day 1 was jam packed with PowerShell goodness.

item.title: Windows Server 2012 Beta Virtual Labs
item.description: Want to test drive the new and improved features of Windows PowerShell? Check out the Windows Server 2012 Beta Virtual Labs page where you can find virtual labs, three of which are on Windows PowerShell!

item.title: Secrets of PowerShell Remoting
item.description: This free guide covers all of the hidden details, configuration tricks, and difficult scenarios involved with Windows PowerShell Remoting. Learn the secret and undocumented tricks to Windows PowerShell Remoting!

item.title: Microsoft Script Explorer for Windows PowerShell
item.description: The pre-release version of Microsoft’s Script Explorer for Windows PowerShell Beta 1 has been released. Download it HERE. Script Explorer Beta 1 is a free download and an extension of the content and guidance experience that combines the vast amount of knowledge held in the community with the resources available today from Microsoft.

item.title: Windows PowerShell for the Busy Admin
item.description: Beginning on Monday, March 12, 2012, Ed Wilson, The Scripting Guy, will start a new series of Learn Windows PowerShell Live Meetings titled “Windows PowerShell for the Busy Admin”.

item.title: PowerShell 3.0 Beta is out
item.description: Windows Management Framework 3.0 – Beta is available for download. Get it HERE. More information on the PowerShell team blog.

item.title: Data ONTAP PowerShell Toolkit 1.7
item.description: The Data ONTAP PowerShell Toolkit 1.7 was released! This latest offering of the very popular PowerShell module for managing NetApp storage systems features over 900 cmdlets.

item.title: The 2012 PowerShell Scripting Games
item.description: The Microsoft Scripting Guys formally announce the 2012 Scripting Games featuring Windows PowerShell. Read the announcement HERE.

item.title: PowerShell Essentials – Become a PowerShell Wiz, Too!
item.description: If you weren’t able to attend “PowerShell Essentials – Become a PowerShell Wiz, Too!” webcast presented by PowerShell MVP and trainer Dr.

item.title: Windows PowerShell sessions from Nordic Infrastructure Conference 2012 available
item.description: For the first time the Nordic Infrastructure Conference (NIC) was held in Oslo, Norway on January 13th – 14th. More than 30 speakers held close to 60 sessions in two days divided into the tracks Security, Virtualization & Cloud, System Management, Unified Communication and Windows 8.

item.title: It’s Time For Another PowerShell Deep Dive!
item.description: The PowerShell Deep Dive is going to be at The Experts Conference USA again this year! The event is being held in San Diego, CA from April 29 – May 2.

item.title: PowerWF and PowerSE 2.7
item.description: PowerWF and PowerSE 2.7 were released to the web and they can now be downloaded from HERE.

item.title: SQLite PowerShell Provider
item.description: PowerShell MVP Jim Christopher has published a new project on codeplex – SQLite PowerShell Provider. The new provider enables you to use SQLite databases from your PowerShell session by mounting the database as a drive.

item.title: Announcing the winners of the PowerShell story series!
item.description: A month ago, we started a contest for our readers to share their first PowerShell experience — their PowerShell story. Along with that, we have also announced that there were prizes to win!

item.title: Getting Started with Windows PowerShell Workflows
item.description: Windows PowerShell workflows consist of a set of activities that run in sequence or in parallel and perform long-running, complex management tasks, such as multimachine application provisioning.

item.title: FREE NetCmdlets Workstation License
item.description: /n software, the makers of NetCmdlets, is offering a FREE NetCmdlets Workstation License_._ NetCmdlets extend the features of Microsoft Windows PowerShell with a broad range of network management and messaging capabilities.

item.title: Windows PowerShell at Microsoft Virtual TechDays (Online event)
item.description: The 13th Edition of Microsoft Virtual TechDays is scheduled between 14-16 December, 2011. Virtual TechDays is an event for all types of audience — developers, IT professionals, and architects.

item.title: WSMAN, WMI, and CIM at the UK PowerShell User Group
item.description: Join the UK PowerShell User Group virtual meeting at Thursday, Dec 15, 2011 7:30 PM (GMT), and discover how to use the WSMAN cmdlets to retreive WMI information and see a demo of the new WMI API’s CIM cmdlets in PowerShell v3 CTP 2.

item.title: Webcast: Enterprise Exchange Management with PowerShell
item.description: In this webcast, Mike Pfeiffer , a Microsoft Exchange MVP, shows how you can take control of your messaging environment using the Exchange Management Shell.

item.title: Windows Management Framework 3.0 Community Technology Preview (CTP) 2 is here
item.description: The PowerShell team has announced the release of Windows Management Framework 3.0 CTP2. The new build contains Windows PowerShell 3.

item.title: An overview of Windows PowerShell features in Windows Server 8 Developer Preview
item.description: This article describes features in a preview of the next version of Windows Server, and features described may and probably will change in the final product.

item.title: PowerShell v3 ISE and ISE scripting model changes & improvements
item.description: PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) in version 2 was a great addition for people who wanted a better script editor with syntax highlighting.

item.title: PowerShell vNext – Web Service Entities
item.description: With the release of Windows 8 and PowerShell V3 CTP1, Microsoft added Management ODATA Web Services Dev. Tools which lets you create PowerShell web services.

item.title: Cmdlet Help Editor was released on CodePlex
item.description: Wassim Fayed [MSFT] has published the source code for the Cmdlet Help Editor on CodePlex. Cmdlet Help Editor enables you to create help topics for Windows PowerShell cmdlets and in the XML format that Windows PowerShell reads.

item.title: Windows Management Framework 3.0 Community Technology Preview (CTP) 1 is here
item.description: Have you tried PowerShell vNext included as a part of Windows 8 client and server developer preview? Don’t have a Windows 8 system to look at it just yet?

item.title: PowerShell Plus v4.1 Has Been Released!
item.description: Idera, a well-known provider of Windows PowerShell management and administration solutions, today announced PowerShell Plus v4.1, the advanced Interactive Development Environment (IDE) for Windows PowerShell.

item.title: PowerShell Magazine at the BUILD conference
item.description: Keith Hill, a PowerShell MVP and the brain behind PowerShell Community Extensions, agreed to get you all the PowerShell information live from the BUILD conference.

item.title: Announcing the launch of PowerShell Magazine website!
item.description: Today, we are very happy to announce the launch of PowerShellMagazine.com – a magazine dedicated to Windows PowerShell. What an exciting journey this was!

item.title: News: Poshoholic moved from Quest to DevFarm
item.description: Kirk Munro a.k.a @Poshoholic announced his departure from Quest on July 28th. Kirk has been very instrumental in several releases of PowerGUI.

item.title: News: PowerShell Deep Dive session at TEC2011
item.description: The Experts Conference 2011, Europe will be hosting the PowerShell Deep Dive. The PowerShell team has announced the first 8 session abstracts for the PowerShell Deep Dive in Frankfurt.

item.title: PowerShell Version 3 Unveiled at Microsoft BUILD Conference
item.description: Microsoft took the wraps off Windows PowerShell V3 at the BUILD conference today in the broader context of the Windows Management Framework (WMF).
